entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:28PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From Utqiagvik East Tonight Into Friday... Northwest winds increasing to 20 mph along the Arctic Coast near Utqiagvik tonight will continue into Thursday and spread east along the Arctic coast. Winds will then turn west on Thursday night and continue into Friday. This will likely cause elevated surf along the Arctic Coast at Utqiagvik from this evening through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 3:28AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND EAST EARLY THIS MORNING... Webcam and satellite imagery, as well as local observations, have shown that patches of dense fog have developed over the central and eastern U.P. early this morning. Expect the patchy dense fog to remain across our central and east until around daybreak.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued September 20 at 9:50PM ADT until September 21 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves around 6 feet and occasionally greater. * WHERE...Beaches of northeastern Puerto Rico. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 21 at 3:44AM EDT until September 21 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 5 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Washington, Southern Bristol MA, Barnstable MA, Dukes MA, Nantucket MA, and Newport RI Counties.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 3:35AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 21 at 1:59AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTHERN AURORA...NORTHWESTERN CHARLES MIX...CENTRAL GREGORY AND NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However, heavy rain is

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 20 at 9:54PM EDT until September 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THURSDAY THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk for rip currents. * WHERE...In Maryland, Maryland Beaches County. In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG EXPECTED THIS MORNING ACROSS NORTHEAST WISCONSIN... Look for patchy dense fog across all of northeast Wisconsin this morning. Rapid reductions of visibilities below one quarter mile are possible in the fog, which could make the morning commute hazardous at times. Where fog develops, visibilities are expected
